page.title: 13THE NEW SOUTH SHIELDS METRO
page.content: The{South Shields Metro Station}was opened in January 1984. The station is in{King Street}in the main shopping area. The trains run every ten minutes. Buses and the Metro system are integrated so that people can either get the bus to the Metro or the Metro to the bus. Fifty nine percent of South Shields families use public transport. The Metro is the predominent provider of public transport. Each day, 160 000 passengers travel on the Metro between {South Shields, Newcastle}and{Whitley {Bay}and 70% of these make part of their journey on the integrated bus service. The Metro has made South Tyneside public transport, of which South Shields Metro Station is a terminus, much more sophisticated.
